snippet: Sheet music by black and Jewish composers goes on display in Harlem; a museum buys an 18th-century Kentucky dresser; an auction features early-1900s posters promoting magicians.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; sheet music by black and Jewish composers goes on display in Harlem; Museum of Early Southern Decorative Arts, in Winston-Salem, NC, buys an 18th-century Kentucky dresser; Alan J Kanter auction features early-1900s posters promoting magicians; Arab American National Museum in Dearborn, Mich, assembles artifacts for Little Syria, NY: An Immigrant Community's Life & Legacy.
lead_paragraph: Sheet music by black and Jewish composers goes on display in Harlem; a museum buys an 18th-century Kentucky dresser; an auction features early-1900s posters promoting magicians.

headline.seo: Black and Jewish Music, Kentucky Cabinets, Magician Posters
headline.main: Black and Jewish Music, Kentucky Cabinets, Magician Posters
headline.print_headline: Harlem Music Culture, Black and Jewish
